plentry.pd: 1: Left channel mode. This mode replaces the right channel audio with the left channel audio, so the user hears only the left channel.
2: Right channel mode. This mode replaces the left channel audio with the right channel audio, so the user hears only the right channel.
3: Mixed mode. This mode overlays the left and right channel data, so the user hears both the left and right channels simultaneously.
1: Left channel mode. This mode replaces the right channel audio with the left channel audio, so the user only hears the left channel audio.
2: Right channel mode. This mode replaces the left channel audio with the right channel audio, so the user only hears the right channel audio.
3: Mixed mode. This mode overlays the left and right channel data, so the user hears both left and right channel audio simultaneously.
1: Left channel mode. This mode replaces the right channel audio with the left channel audio, so the user can only hear the left channel.
2: Right channel mode. This mode replaces the left channel audio with the right channel audio, so the user can only hear the right channel.
3: Mixed mode. This mode overlays the left and right channel data, so the user can hear both channels simultaneously.
1: Left channel mode. This mode replaces the right channel audio with the left channel audio, so the user hears only the left channel.
2: Right channel mode. This mode replaces the left channel audio with the right channel audio, so the user hears only the right channel.
3: Mix mode. This mode overlays the left and right channel data so the user hears both channels simultaneously.
